Class of the Elite is a unique show. 
The show focuses on our male protagonist Ayanokouji, and his entrance into a prestigious school, one where those who make it to the top are guarenteed success in the future. 
The show succeeds in being a bit unorthodox. The school system is run by points, and merits, and all your money is connected to said "stats". The strength of this show comes from its suspense, character variability, and frankly, the fact that you make many guesses, some which come true, and other which don't.
Little backstory is known about many of the characters, but their interactions are interestingas is the school which allows ANYTHING to be bought, bartered, or traded for the right price. 


The show leaves its mysteries, and utilizes character drama and small tests to capture the audience. I wouldn't call it a great show, but its compelling enough to make you want to learn more about the school, student board, and characters antics.


The MC is very likable in the way hes nearly a shadow, slipping through the cracks and manipulating those around him, and his story is still fairly unknown.


If you're interesting in a fairly simple show with a few twists, a lot of mild suspense, odd charecters,and a fairly unique school setting, this isn't a bad show to pick up. I give it a 7 out of 10 for worth the watch, but dont expect to be blown away.

Classroom of the elite is a seemingly great show, it has solid, interesting and mysterious characters, a good setting and great art. But after a few episodes I have to say that this anime is really having a hard time deciding what it "really" wants to be, it started off as a slice of life school romance anime and quickly turned into a sort of survive the school-esk show (like food wars), not that that is a truly bad thing. 
Let's go over the anime step by step, first the story, we have our main character Ayanokouji Kiyotaka, a silent protaganist that barely shows emotion,as he is on his way to the new school of the elite - Koudo Ikusei Senior high school, a school only for the best of the best. In episode 1 an idea is established that basically society is not truly equal, and everyone has some sort of standing, would it be lower or higher than another person, and that the world is unfair. This is well presented with the school itself, despite it being the school for the best of the best, there are still classes representing your value based on which one you were put in, class A being the highest, class B, class C, and finally class D, where our main character resides. Upon first arriving at the school he meets a girl named Horikita Suzune, an ice queen of sorts that rarely shows alot of emotions and is also very cold and ignoring of everyone around her, as she finds things like friends to be meaningless and an obstacle to her true goal, to reach class A.

We also have our second main female lead Kushida Kukiyo, a very cheerful girl who wants to be friends with everyone. Now when you see these characters probably one anime came to mind, that being My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU or Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Comedy wa Machigatteiru - in japanese. The characters are extremely similiar, and I'm not talking only about our main characters, but alot of the side characters aswell. But sadly if  you are searching for the next SNAFU, this isn't it, it is very different when compared to SNAFU. As SNAFU focuses on it's down to earth tone and relatable characters to drive it's plot, Classroom of the elite is alot more "Anime" if that makes sense, the characters are relatable to some extent, but going into the anime you start to realise just how distant they actually are. As for continuing the story, Ayanokoji, our main character, enrows in this school expecting a calm and peaceful school life, but is greeted with a very twisted school enviroment. It turns out that in Koudo Ikusei High School is far from a normal school, in this school every class earns points based on what ranking the class is in, students use these points to live in this new school enviroment, in this school these points are everything. This plotline of an elite school which has some seriously twisted rules and is extremely strict reminds me alot of the school in Food Wars, and it is in concept fairly similar. Overall the story itself revolves itself on our main characters thriving to survive and eventually reach class A, a simple plot, but what adds depth to the story are the mysterious characters and circumstances behind how the school truly works. So the story gets a 7 out of me, a decent enough story that is carried by it's characters rather than it standing on it's own.


Characters: I will make this brief as I already talked a bit about our 3 main characters and only a bit about the side characters, overall they all have some sort of mystery surrounding them and are all in all pretty well fleshed out characters, although some of the less recurring characters can come off as very one note, but for now the characters are the main reason why I am watching this anime along with the mystery behind them and their pasts. So for that the anime gets a 9 in this department.


Art: The art was made by studio Lerche, the studio responsible for the danganronpa anime and assassination classroom most notably, which explains why I felt like I had seen the animation and art somewhere, and also why I enjoy it so much. Overall if you have seen studio Lerche's work and you enjoyed it, you will enjoy this anime aswell. The art gets a 9 from me, very fluid and consistent and just overall very good to look at, especially the eyes of the characters, just from looking at their eyes you can sort of understand the personality of the character, which is something I find to be very impressive.


The sound gets a pass from me, the opening and closing are nothing special and the music during the anime is pretty average aswell, sadly I will have to give it just a 6 in this department, as nothing much stood out to me, although I do enjoy the opening quite a bit.


Enjoyment: I enjoy this anime, but at the same time it feels like this anime is abandoning it's main plotline and theme and is just sort of going with the flow, it hasn't really stuck itself to one idea and it can come off as sort of unsure in itself at times. Also another thing I just have to note is that this anime actually has a filler episode, and no I don't mean it's an uninteresting episode that barely advanced the plot, it was just a fanservice episode that basically did nothing in line with advancing the plot, you could just remove this episode and you will see no difference in the main story, from what I can tell, this anime will probably be atleast 25 episodes so I guess 1 episode being filler isn't that bad, just hope they don't do anymore, the random flash of fanservice really ruined the pacing and feel for this show for me for quite a long while, but I have gotten over it. I would say that besides those few gripes I do find myself really enjoying this anime, it is not the SNAFU 2 that I wanted, but it is still a very solid and unique series. It gets an 8 from me.


Overall: This anime has it's ups and downs, but it is definitely one of the better shows from the summer season and you should check it out without a doubt. I might update this review, if I remember, after the anime ends, but as it is right now I can safely give this anime an 8/10.

Classroom of the Elite...is...interesting to say the least. I'm rating it fairly high but it could easily go up or down. That's one of the reasons I'm enjoying this show, it isn't really clear what's going to happen and that is a nice feeling! 
Is the MC a good guy about to get a harem or a secret sociopath? Honestly either outcome is possible and I have my own feelings. 
Story: 7/10
Some reviews have downplayed this show as yet another wasted potential, but that seems a little unfair because we have yet to see most of the plot or the reveal which is SURE tocome. The setting is interesting, however I agree with others, it is unrealistic and trivial. I mean rich kids in a school competing doesn't really seem like a lot of stakes, but the show manages to convince you it is somehow. Already lines are being drawn and it is clear multiple students are aiming for the top and going to use any means necessary. We have gotten to know mainly the Class D characters and most of the plot is their struggles, including being targeted by higher classes. The plot could be really interesting or turn out really lame but I've been enjoying the mystery as it isn't clear where it is going and I've enjoyed seeing the intellectual battles between students including entrapment so far! \n\n
Characters: 8/10 [spoilers]\n
A lot of the Class D students are incredibly stupid and lazy. I assume this was done to create early conflict. The kids came and thought they'd have it easy here, spent all their money in the first month, and goofed off in class, but then had a rude awakening and the teacher mocks them for it. I agree, these kids deserved it and it is weak writing. However, after the first couple episodes under the surface there are a lot of intriguing characters developing. It seems almost every character has secret motivations, including the teachers. Already we've seen two characters seemingly reversed, yanked out of comfortable stereotypes into dangerous hidden sides. Some, if not the majority, may be sociopaths. On the surface it may seem like the MC is your typical nice guy but I really don't think it'll go down that way. I suspect the show is planning a reversal where the people you liked turn out to be not so nice and vice versa. It has already happened once with the bubbly girl. This MC though...definitely not your run of the mill guy. For one he keeps pulling out remarkable skills and is very astute, helping others out, yet claims to not care about anything. You start to realize he knows a lot and can manipulate people at will including his supposed friends. Something weird is going on with him behind those dead eyes. He gives me the chills and Episodes 5 pretty much confirms he has his own dark agenda--whatever that is. We'll see! \n\n
Art & Sound: 5/10\n
The animation is ok and serves its purpose. It doesn't seem particularly impressive though and often lacks attention to detail except in the key scenes. \n\n
Excited to see where this one goes! I'm following it every week!

To start off, at the time of writing I have watched 6 of its episodes and I expect this series to end as at least one of my memorable ones. I'm going to break down my content.

The premise of the story is strong. It is one of those scenarios where the rules are very strong within the setting but also does not have serious implications should something go wrong. So the tldr on this show is it's kinda interesting but definitely not "good." This show isn't gonna blow you away with its brilliant art or fascinating and unique characters, nor is it's plot gonna have any twists that are outside of what you come to expect from shows like this one. That being said it does manage to hold my attention pretty well and if you're not looking for something spectacular and just want something interesting to watch this show could be what you are looking for.
Story-
It's a high school for the super elite, or so they say. In reality, I think it'd bemore accurate to say that it is a high school that produces the super elite. Unfortunately, this is one of those shows where the people making it weren't aware of their status as a fairly basic anime, and as a result, this show suffers from that pretension that often haunts anime. They try to be all philosophical at times but it doesn't really work. Not gonna spoil anything but the plot is definitely set up in a pretty interesting manner by the end of the first episode.


Art/Sound-

Gonna be quick as there generally isn't much to say about these in mainstream commercial anime. Everything is, for the most part, well polished yet supremely regular. I will say that the music for me was a big plus. Manages to add to the tone quite nicely.


Characters- 

They are all tropes. Yes, I know, pretty much every anime character created recently is a trope I'm just letting you know that this show is the same. If you make the mistake of thinking "wow that character is super interesting and unique" it's probably just because you have yet to encounter that type of character. The MC, in particular, is a hardcore trope. I'm gonna tell you his dere type which may be considered a spoiler so skip ahead if you don't wanna know...... Ready? He's a kuudere. Yup another one, and get this they totally try to sell him as some pathetic loner guy at the start before he starts forming his harem and releasing his hidden OP anime protagonist powers. If you've never seen this trope before I'm shocked you've made it to this site. Oh and the front runner for best girl (she may not be best girl but is first girl if ya know what I mean (as in she is the first harem member)) i'll give you one guess at her dere type. Yup, tsundere. If you got that wrong please leave.


Enjoyment- 

Like I said it's entertaining. If you are a vet who enjoys their tropes then you at the very least will be satisfied by the execution of those roles in this anime.

A series of wasted opportunities. You-Zitsu is not your usual harem anime where girls swoon over the protagonists. Its fill with many interesting and eccentric characters, which the show fails to explore their motivation and individual stories. Ie, the narcissistic Koenji who showed many potential to be a key driving force in the class's success but was shoved away as cheap "gay" humour. 
Credit where credit is due, bland characters like Ike whom you'll traditionally write off as wallpaper, actually had depth and the show paints them in a new light for the audience to be more accepting of them. 
If you're a seasoned animeviewer, you'll see the ending from a mile away. Though kiyotaka's monologue at the end felt pretentious as you never really explore his character motivation other than being "mysterious" and laid-back.

To keep this short I would say that this show has an interesting premise but is far to predictable for it's own good. In my opinion a psychological mystery show should have a few clues to get the viewer speculating, but should also try to keep a few cards up it's sleeve.
 The character motivations are obvious from the get go but it made me hopeful I was reading to much into the characters them selves and the story would take a surprising turn. ultimately it has potential for a second season but given how not much happens in the twelve episodes shownI just couldn't justify giving it more then a five.\n\n
 What I will say is that the music is fairly catch and the art is at least average. This is the ultimate middle of the road anime but  at the end of the day if this show has all the tags you like to see then go for it otherwise go find something else to enjoy.
